text: Ramla bint Abi sufyan(umme Habiba) Ramla bint Abi Sufyan ibn Harb, also known as Umm Habiba, was one of the wives of the Islamic prophet Muhammad . \- She was born in 589 or 594 CE, the daughter of Abu Sufyan ibn Harb and Safiyyah bint Abi al-'As. \- She was a member of the Quraysh tribe and the sister of Muawiyah I, the first Umayyad caliph. \- She married Ubayd Allah ibn Jahsh and was one of the earliest converts to Islam. \- She migrated to Abyssinia (Ethiopia) with her husband and daughter, Habibah. \- After her husband's death, she married the Prophet Muhammad through a marriage contract conducted by the Negus of Abyssinia. \- She lived in Medina and was known for her piety, narrating around 65 hadiths of Muhammad. \- She passed away in 664 or 665 CE and was buried in Jannat al-Baqi cemetery next to other wives of Muhammad. Category:Family of Muhammad Category:660s deaths
title: Umm Habiba
